result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian S Ziegelmann

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court's denying defendant's request for leniency
Jail Inmate Communication Form filed by defendant requesting leniency.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

Defendant Brian S Ziegelmann in court, in custody, with attorney Erik I. Colque.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    State moves to have this case dismissed and read-in to 15CT65 , Court grants the State's motion.

Br. 1 only
Bail Jumping in 15CT65
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture

Attorney Erik I. Colque in court.   Defendant Brian S Ziegelmann did not appear.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant did not appear, case was set for 10:00, case was called at 10:06 a.m.  Based on defendant's non appearance, Court orders bail be revoked and forfieted.  Court issues capias.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
treatment letter
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

Attorney Erik I. Colque in court.   Defendant Brian S Ziegelmann did not appear.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Colque states the case was going to settle today but requests to set for plea and sentencing.
Court removes from trial calendar.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on July 9, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Brian S Ziegelmann in court with attorney Erik I. Colque.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. WCS report addressed. Defendant to go to WCS to be tested. Defendant to bring his prescription with him. Defendant advises his prescription was thrown away. Defense requests a plea/sentencing date. Court will set this matter for trial. Court will review bail at this time. Court sets new bail at $500.00 cash in 15CT65. Defense is not raising competency issue. Court will give a jury status/jury trial date on file 15CT65. Other files to trail along - 15CM457, 15TR268 and 15TR269.  Hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Return of Hearing returned for: 6/19/15
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 19, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

Attorney Erik I. Colque in court.   Defendant Brian S Ziegelmann did not appear.   Lucas Paul Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.

Defendant Brian S Ziegelmann in court with attorney Erik I. Colque.  Lucas Paul Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Colque requests a new date.  Court reviews WCS non-compliance letter and takes no action today.  Upon another non-compliance the court will revoke bail and issue a capias.

Defendant to provide proof of Valium prescribed by Waukesha Memorial to to WCS and the Court by noon on 6-1-15.  Hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.

Court addresses WCS non-compliance letters.  Statements by atty. Colque.
Court appoints Atty. Colque on this case.  
Court admonishes the defendant.  Hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Hearing on May 4, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.
Hearing on May 11, 2015 at 09:30 am.

The Court to address at the 5/11/15 hearing per Judge Bohren.
Defendant to have no contact with Brigid A. listed in the Criminal Complaint or her residence.

Defendant Brian S Ziegelmann in court, in custody.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Complaint read to defendant.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 09:30 am.
